t: Amazon says it’s permanently banned 600 Chinese brands for review fraud | The Verge
s: September 17, 2021 - Following the high-profile disappearances of Aukey, Mpow, RavPower, Choetech and more, Amazon now says it’s cracked down on 3,000 seller accounts across 600 Chinese brands over the past five months.

t: Top U.S. Amazon sellers are furious about the ‘avalanche’ of Chinese competitors—and they crave a Trump intervention
s: February 12, 2025 - That includes Chinese-based sellers not having to pay U.S. income tax. Additionally, some Chinese sellers have been able to take advantage of a trade rule known as “de minimis” that lets them ship sub-$800 orders to U.S. customers without paying tariffs or duties.

t: Pukemark, Sweatyrocks, Demonlick: Made-for-Amazon Brand Names Are Getting Ridiculously Surreal
s: October 14, 2020 - I was recently shopping for clothes on Amazon when I noticed bizarre brand names popping up—more bizarre than usual, I mean. It’s common to come across unfamiliar brands on Amazon, where sellers are constantly fashioning product lines and whole brands around what shoppers are searching for.

t: Amazon China - Wikipedia
s: 1 week ago - Amazon China (Chinese: 亚马逊中国), formerly known as Joyo.com (Chinese: 卓越网), is an online shopping website. Joyo.com was founded in early 2000 by the Chinese entrepreneur Lei Jun in Beijing, China. The company primarily sold books and other media goods, shipping to customers nationwide.
